com.nhn.android.maps.overlay

Class NMapPathData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nhn.android.maps.overlay.NMapPathData

  • public class NMapPathData
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a path data on map view overlay.

      • initPathData

        public void initPathData()
        Initialize path data.
        Parameters:
        count - total number of path points.

      • addPathPoint

        public void addPathPoint(int utmkX,
                int utmkY,
                int lineType,
                boolean isControlPoint)
        Add a path point in UTMK coordinates.
        Parameters:
        utmkX - x coordinates of a path point.
        utmkX - y coordinates of a path point.
        lineType - path line type to the next point, useful for transit traffic route. This could be 0 for intermediate or end of path points.
        isControlPoint - set true to show this point regardless of zoom levels. default value is false. Some path points could be hidden to optimize rendering performance if this value was set to false.
        See Also:
        NMapPathLineStyle

      • addPathPoint

        public void addPathPoint(int utmkX,
                int utmkY,
                int lineType)
        Add a path point in UTMK coordinates.
        Parameters:
        utmkX - x coordinates of a path point.
        utmkX - y coordinates of a path point.
        lineType - path line type to the next point, useful for transit traffic route. This could be 0 for intermediate or end of path points.
        See Also:
        NMapPathLineStyle

      • addPathPoint

        public void addPathPoint(double longitude,
                double latitude,
                int lineType,
                boolean isControlPoint)
        Add a path point in GRS coordinates.
        Parameters:
        longitude - x coordinates of a path point.
        latitude - y coordinates of a path point.
        lineType - path line type to the next point, useful for transit traffic route. This could be 0 for intermediate or end of path points.
        isControlPoint - set true to show this point regardless of zoom levels. default value is false. Some path points could be hidden to optimize rendering performance if this value was set to false.
        See Also:
        NMapPathLineStyle

      • addPathPoint

        Add a path point in GRS coordinates.
        Parameters:

        latitude - y coordinates of a path point.
        lineType - path line type to the next point, useful for transit traffic route. This could be 0 for intermediate or end of path points.
        See Also:

      • endPathData

        public void endPathData()
        End of path data. Note: The bounds of path data is computed during addPathPoint().

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(int left,
             int top,
             int right,
             int bottom)
        Set bounds of path data in UTMK coordinates. Note: The given bounds is used for adjusting the zoom level to show all path data within NMapView.
        Parameters:
        left - minimum value of longitude.
        top - maximum value of latitude.
        right - maximum value of longitude.
        bottom - minimum value of latitude.

      • getBounds

        public android.graphics.Rect getBounds()
        Returns:
        the bounds of path data in UTMK coordinates.

      • isValidBounds

        public boolean isValidBounds()

      • getBoundsOffset

        public android.graphics.Point getBoundsOffset(NMapView mapView,
                                     boolean isDrawnOnSnapshot)
        Get bounds offset of the path data with respect to the bounds after zoom levels changed. Note: This is used to not evaluate screen pixel coordinates for every rendering of path data without changing zoom levels.
        Returns:
        bounds offset in screen coordinates.

      • onSizeChanged

        public void onSizeChanged(int width,
                 int height)

      • setPathLineStyle

        public void setPathLineStyle(NMapPathLineStyle pathLineStyle)
        set path line style. if not specified, default line style is used.
        Parameters:
        pathLineStyle - path line style

      • getPathLineStyle

        public NMapPathLineStyle getPathLineStyle()
        get path line style.
